author: {'steamid': '76561198108265772', 'num_games_owned': 1848, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1693690424}
review:
Big Fish Legend is an older PC game, very reminiscent of even older platformers. I am honestly glad older games like this can make their way to steam and be preserved so that future generations can enjoy them. I don't even think it's a completely terrible game. So why don't I recommend it? Well, I do think with just a little polish this game could be worthy of a recommendation, but I was experiencing too many glitches from tilesets breaking, levels loading incorrectly, and even complete crashes that closed the game. 

The hand-drawn graphics are cute and charming, and I like the wall climb mechanic as it felt very unique compared to other platformers of the time. Another thing I felt was unique about this game was that the achievements actually affect gameplay. For example, the doghunter achievement will make the dog enemies easier to defeat. I do think this game has potential and I have not played any other copies of this game to know if it ran better before it came to steam, it really is just the bugs that hold it back for me. 

A lot of older reviews for this game cite a high price point for what it is, however the game is now completely free so that is not an issue. You honestly have nothing to lose by trying it out, and I can at least see a little kid or someone who wants a very basic platformer having some fun with it, but at the same time kids can do better. All of Humongous Entertainment's offerings are available here on steam after all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049459983', 'num_games_owned': 421, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 446, 'last_played': 1604947349}
review:
Big Fish Legend is a fun and exciting video game that is perfect for kids. This game takes place in a magical underwater world, where players get to explore and discover all sorts of amazing creatures and treasures.

One of the best things about Big Fish Legend is how colorful and visually appealing it is. The game's graphics are bright and vibrant, and the character designs are cute and charming. Kids will love discovering all the different creatures in the game, from friendly fish to mischievous octopi.

Another great feature of Big Fish Legend is how easy it is to play. The game's controls are simple and intuitive, and kids will be able to pick up the game quickly and start having fun right away. And with its fun and playful soundtrack, Big Fish Legend is sure to put a smile on your child's face.

Finally, the game's challenges are just right for kids. The game's levels are designed to be challenging, but not too difficult, and kids will have a blast working through the different challenges and obstacles. And if they get stuck, they can always ask for help from a friend or family member.

In conclusion, Big Fish Legend is a fantastic video game for kids. It's fun, engaging, and visually appealing, and it's sure to provide hours of entertainment for kids of all ages. So if you're looking for a great game for your child, be sure to check out Big Fish Legend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1648118282}
review:
Big Fish Legend is a 2D retro platformer where you control a small cat and jump around collecting gems and so on.  The game has the unusual feature that you can run up and down walls, which is needed to collect some of the gems and pass some of the levels, but that's all there is to differentiate this from the thousands of other platformers on Steam. 

On the upside the artwork looks okay, it's not retro pixel "art" garbage, so that's a big plus.   It goes to show once more that 2D retro pixel "art" is just a weak cop-out from amateur game developers who can't do better.  Thumbs up for having real art in a 2D indie game, it's a nice change. 

Unfortunately, resolution and controls are locked and can't be changed, so there's no way to improve the game experience, and with locked controls this can make the game inaccessible to some, so it's unclear why that decision was made.  Gameplay itself is also lacklustre as the animations don't neatly match the movement.  Controls are floaty and imprecise, and unfortunately precise controls and a good game feel and handling are an absolute must for any platformer. 

The game is completely free.  Nothing speaks more to a developers belief in themselves and their product than making their game available for everyone without remuneration.  This is certainly a gesture that shows dedication to the gaming industry.  It's a shame in this case that the implementation is below the minimum standards a dedicated PC game should offer to enthusiasts.   There's no "maybe" option in Steam, unfortunately, but I hope to see more work from this developer, perhaps as part of a professional game development company that can make full use of their talents without needing to make budget/quality compromises.

author: {'steamid': '76561198860959520', 'num_games_owned': 1582, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 511, 'last_played': 1617953574}
review:
This game is absolutely fantastic! Took me 8 hours to complete and I enjoyed every second. There are still some glitches and stuff (at one point. for example, all the floor tiles became invisible/intangible, so I would fall to my death just restarting the level. That was really weird. I had to quickly pause the game and exit the level. It only happened once, in that one level, so I wouldn't say it's a recurring issue).

The game is not without challenges, especially in "special" levels (namely, timed levels and levels where you can't kill any enemies, which is sometimes harder than it sounds). Bosses are rather easy, and if you die in any level, all the progress you've made will still remain (i.e., enemies you killed stay dead, you keep the keys you have found, the doors remain open, etc.), which includes the number of hits you've managed to inflict to a boss (making it even easier).

The physics are OK, although the mid-air movement is a bit weird and takes some getting used to. My only complaint would be about chains. Once I grabbed one, there was no way for me to go down the chain, only further up. I played with a controller and nothing ever happened when I pushed the thumb stick down, but now that I think of it, it might have been a mapping problem. I still managed without it, which required some additional platforming skill (i.e. jumping at the right angle).

I have no complaints about the story, the graphics, sounds or music. The game feels like a 90s era platformer, with cute graphics. And best of all, it's free! I don't think you can get a lot of better deals than this. There are a total of 61 levels in the game, 4 of which are boss levels. The game has cards and (fairly easily achievable) achievements.

If you like old-school relaxing platformers with a slight touch of puzzling, this game is definitely for you. I have to admit that I was pleasantly surprised and even impressed with this little free gem. Big thumbs up!

author: {'steamid': '76561198130262111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 261, 'playtime_forever': 442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1542575177}
review:
¬°Please, spanish subtitles in game!
Me ha gustado el juego. Entretenido juego de plataformas 2D, con una simple historia, con un bonito dise√±o gr√°fico, unos personajes llamativos, una banda sonora aceptable, posee logros y cromos Steam.
Su dificultad es f√°cil, siempre y cuando uses un game pad. Y la duraci√≥n es de un d√≠a.

Pero el juego posee algunos aspectos que no me han gustado:
1)	El juego no est√° traducido al castellano. Una verdadera l√°stima. No es que la historia sea dif√≠cil de entender, pero creo que los creadores debieron haber contactado con traductores amateurs de la comunidad Steam, para pasar al espa√±ol el poqu√≠simo contenido en texto que posee el juego. Ya que ayudar√≠a much√≠simo aquellos que no entienden un carajo el ingl√©s.

2)	Encontr√© un bug en una de las misiones del primer mapa, donde el sonido de los pasos de un escorpi√≥n se qued√≥ en modo repetici√≥n todo el rato, y no se quit√≥ hasta que sal√≠ del juego, e volv√≠ a entrar.

3)	A vista de mapa, eche en falta un cartel informativo en cada fase, que indicara el n√∫mero de enemigos que has vencido, las gemas que has obtenido, los secretos obtenidos y el tipo de medalla. De esta manera, sabr√≠as en que misi√≥n no has obtenido el 100%.

4)	El contabilizador de enemigos en algunas fases est√° mal. Porque pone como enemigo contable, los p√°jaros enormes (los que usas para volar), cuando son seres que no pueden ser destruidos.

5)	Alg√∫n enemigo o gema son imposibles de obtener, debido a que no existe manera de alcanzarlo. Haciendo imposible de conseguir el 100% de la fase.

6)	Eche en falta algunos logros‚Ä¶
a)	Conseguir todas las gemas
b)	Eliminar todos los enemigos
c)	Descubrir todas las zonas secretas
d)	Conseguir todas la medalla de oro en todos los niveles
e)	Logro por conseguir todos los logros.

7)	Que el propio juego no a√±adiese un programa editor, para crear tus propias fases. Y dar la opci√≥n de a√±adirlo a Steam Workshop.

En definitiva, es un juego que recomiendo, para aquellos que deseen un videojuego simple para pasar el rato. Debido a su carencia de violencia, es apto para ni√±os.
Si vas comprarlo, adqui√©relo al precio 1‚Ç¨, formando parte de alg√∫n bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058584412', 'num_games_owned': 9611, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1485471641}
review: Easy to not recommend at the listed price.  A little harder to not recommend if it was 75% off or more.  It's boring, though.  I played through 12 levels and couldn't bring myself to continue.  There are numerous paths and things to collect, but they don't seem to matter at all, in that there are no achievements or bonuses tied to them.  Sure, there are medals at the end of each level, but once I quit trying to get everything, I still got gold medals just rushing through the levels.  I got 1-1.5 hours of mild fun out of it, so the whole game may take 5 hours or so, it's just hard to believe you'd still be having fun by that point in time.

[h1] Gameplay [/h1] Ein simpler Platformer. Es gibt einige verschiedene Gegnertypen. Die meisten sind via Sprung auf den Kopf zu besiegen. Es gibt auch einige Boss K√§mpfe, die ganz Nett sind. Nach einiger Zeit fliegt man allerdings aus dem Spiel raus (warum auch immer) und manchmal f√§llt man beim starten eines Neuen Levels einfach durch den Boden

author: {'steamid': '76561198018214616', 'num_games_owned': 1252, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1455669424}
review:
[h1][b]Public Review on behalf of the Opium Pulses Steam group[/b][/h1]

[b]Disclaimer[/b]: The copy of this game was provided by [url=www.orlygift.com][b]Orlygift[/b][/url]. Thank you for making this review possible!

[b]Few words about the game[/b]
Big Fish Legend is pretty fun adventure game with puzzle and platformer elements, perfect for kids or just for a quick, evening ride with something to relax your brain. You're in control of a kitty on a quest to find a legendary fish, going through lots of different levels.

[b]Advantages[/b]
[list]
[*] - Cute and simple graphics
[*] - Nice background music, well suited to the game overally
[*] - Pretty long and not that much repetetive
[*] - Perfect to introduce young gamers into gaming world
[*] - Easy controls
[/list]

[b]Disadvantages[/b]
[list]
[*] - Too expensive for what it offers
[*] - English translation could be a bit better
[/list]

[b]Summary[/b]
Game is pretty fun, I'm pretty sure it was created to entertain younger community and it worked in my opinion. I'd recommend not to pay whole 7‚Ç¨ for it, try to get it for free or at least bundled somewhere.

Personal score
[table]
[tr]
[th]
7 / 10
[/th]
[/tr]
[/table]

[i]If you find my review helpful or funny be sure to follow [b]Opium Pulses[/b] curator page right [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/OpiumPulsesNews#curation]here[/url] for more reviewed games![/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198145871719', 'num_games_owned': 7999, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1464434037}
review:
I cannot recommend this game to the gaming population in general, or even platformer enthusiasts in general. I can only honestly recommend this game for a very specific type of player. 

The game should appeal to younger gamers and those looking for a very casual gaming experience, and even more specifically, players that won't mind, or won't notice, the "cookie-cutter" level design that is repetitious and unimaginative. 

However, there is an additional issue with the controls and the texture of the surfaces. That issue is that the surfaces provide absolutely no traction or resistance, meaning that the entire game is like playing an "ice" world/level in another game. This can be challenging and fun in small doses, but when a game is like that in its entirety, especially when it's obviously suited for younger and/or casual gamers, it doesn't make sense. 

During my gameplay, I had extreme difficulty with this, because the character slides when you're not touching the controls, causing the cat to slip right over the edge of very short horizontal ledges and surfaces and to slide down on vertical surfaces. 

Wall-jumping mechanics are also flawed here because of this slippage. It's difficult to jump from one vertical surface to another without sliding backwards or overshooting entirely. 

I also noticed that the jump height and distance were inconsistent. At times, the cat jumped higher or further than it did during consecutive attempts in the same spot, and I couldn't figure out a reason for that other than design flaw. I didn't find a double jump, high jump, or sprint capability, so that didn't explain it, either. 

I was also disappointed by the poor grammar and spelling, which was distracting to me and seems likely due to poor English translation. 

Gamers looking for an immersive storyline in which to engage will not find that here. That aspect was also way below the average "grab the coins/gems" jumping platformers. As one who sometimes just wants to play a game without having to think too much, I can appreciate why the level design and problem solving/strategy aspects might have been purposely simplistic, but when the design itself or game mechanics, such as movement and controls, introduce illogical and inconsistent difficulty, that appreciation for a purposeful decision is replaced by disappointment for error and/or complacency. The resulting confusion and frustration completely negate any appreciation. 

I actually had this game on my wishilist and was very happy to see it come up in a recent bundle offer. If I'd paid full price for this game, I'd be much more disappointed than I am, and most likely very upset. 

If you can find the game for a buck or two (or included in a bundle) and the issues I've mentioned don't deter you, then this may in fact be a game for you to try. On the other hand, if you're seeking consistency, high replayability, immersive storyline, a challenging puzzle platformer, or unique level design, then you're best looking elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991369092', 'num_games_owned': 2901, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1453097525}
review:
An indie game by a very small russian team and BOY does it show.  

Broken english throughout, mediocre level design, 0 innovation in later levels, sloppy mechanics, the list goes on.  Odds are you picked this from WGN, if you didn't you massively overpayed for it.  Farm this game for cards and then forget about it, because it's not even worth the miniscule waste of your hard-drive space.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987388969', 'num_games_owned': 1737, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 1333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1333, 'last_played': 1445356565}
review: Big Fish Legend is a 2D side scroller, where you play as a cat who must collect jewels, defeat enemies, uncover hidden secrets and navigate through level after level of various maze-like locations. You are scored points based on how well you accomplish each of these individual tasks, once you reach the end of the level gate. The game is very straight forward and simple. It is played using the mouse and takes a moment to adjust to not using the keyboard. The mazes seem pretty simplistic, although I would imagine the higher levels offer more complexity. Timing jumps is key to acquiring all the jewels and reaching some spots necessary to earn gold in a level, so you may end up practicing a timed jump a few times before you are able to do it. The graphics are very simple, the music isn't overly annoying, All in all, not a bad game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035355941', 'num_games_owned': 7701, 'num_reviews': 178, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1503143030}
review:
My first computer game. For ages 18 months to 24 months.

Actually it is pretty cute. But I'm clearly not the demographic for this game. Got it in a bundle. Also apparently developers had shenanigans.

Rating, purely the game - yes if you have a very young child you want to introduce to platforming. Or if you want something cute with no challenge whatsoever. If you want a kids game that is also fun for adults, go check out Marvin's Mittens.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031582331', 'num_games_owned': 6781, 'num_reviews': 768, 'playtime_forever': 452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 452, 'last_played': 1442701317}
review:
5min of this game (mainly with the mouse controls)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ApB5RNheF6A

this is more or less a "flash" game with collecting, & puzzle elements. you can move left, right, and jump also you can climb walls. you lost 1 of your 3 lives if you get hit by traps or enemies to many times and lose all your hp but when you do lose them all you just have to start from the beginning of that level. the goal is to get to the end of the level or beat a boss. some times you need to find a element and/or keys to unlock a door. there are also gems to collect, chains to clime, and you can Mario stomp enemies. at the end of every zone there is a boss you'll need to figure out how to take out. 

the games is not overly hard but the mouse controls are really hard to get used to. when you keep the mouse under your cat it will make him stay and moving it anywhere to the left or right will make him move in that direction then you click to jump. it sounds simple but its very hard to keep control of kitty this way fortunately you can also use the keyboard's arrow keys.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077387115', 'num_games_owned': 4065, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1438715822}
review:
A very interesting casual platformer game that appeals to people looking for a product quirky, simple and relaxed in difficulty to pass some time, best played in smaller intervals as there are elements of repetition. The overall goal is to bring the main character, a charming kitten, across 60 levels of various difficulty, with small variations such as time limits or without killing any monsters. 

The levels gradually introduce more game mechanics as the game slowly becomes increasingly challenging, but largely remain within a few minutes of length, including fairly simple puzzle solving that requires fetching keys or manipulating boulders to push buttons to open doors, or grabbing a key item to unlock the exit gate. At the end of each game world, a boss fight occurs.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
[b]Controls[/b]
The main issue about the game itself is its control scheme. You can choose to control the kitty with either the keyboard or mouse. The cat moves frictionlessly on both air and ground, making each command feel as if you are navigating on slippery ice, and making air control almost impossible. Using a mouse, you obtain precise movement control but it becomes almost impossible to control jumps as the cat will attempt to follow your cursor immediately after the jump. 

Speaking of jumping, the kitten automatically clings to walls and ropes when touching them, and if your jump button is held for one second longer than that, it immediately jumps off again. This means that to control your jumps you have to press the button before you hit a wall/rope and then let go of the button the second before you hit it, then climb it and hit the button again. If you are not used to this, you will be in trouble. (Ordinary platformers negate the jump input until you release and press the button again.)

Generally speaking, the combination of lack of air and jump control causes much frustration as you will repeatedly fail the occasional tricky jump and even more frequently get hit by monsters by not approaching them from the correct angle (from above) and feel stupid. While it could be argued that this adds a challenge to the game, no player would appreciate fake difficulty stemming from poor programming. As the creators of SMB put it, real difficulty must give the player full control and responsibility for his mistakes. In other words, input must be responsive, and this isn't (or you could say that it is way too responsive/sensitive).

[b]General[/b]
The game keeps a fair learning curve introducing monsters and mechanics very gradually, even considering the added difficulty from the suboptimal controls. If you die, you respawn at the beginning or at a nearby checkpoint saving all progress you made through the level. One life lasts you about five hits from any hazards, and you carry excess lives across levels (as well as getting fully healed when completing a level).

By collecting the generous amount of gems scattered in each level and defeating monsters, you obtain points, which aside from giving you a pointless rating at the end of each level (outside achievements bounds, even) gives you a health effect for each 20,000 points collected in that level. Finding a heart power-up gives you the same effect. I say 'health effect' because there is a hefty problem here. See, if you happen to be at full health when getting point no. 20,000 or picking up a heart, you gain an extra life. If not, then it simply heals you. No matter how close you were to full health. This means that essentially, unless you happen to be at full health at the right time, you are 'wasting' part of the effect for no reason. This is a serious design flaw. Combined with how easy it is to get accidentally get hit by monsters, good luck picking up that last gem or heart for an extra life without getting it wasted for nothing. 

Last but not least, since 20,000 is the key amount of points, any number of leftover points at the end of a level that doesn't divide cleanly by this amount is used for absolutely nothing (apart from the aforementioned rating). An interesting note is that they do actually accumulate between levels, but the 20,000 needed for health always counts from 0 when starting a new level.

A quick note on game physics: On top of our kitty vertically climbing walls (which due to clever design is not as much of an overpowered trait as it sounds) it can also push boulders around with the same ease as if they were made of papier-m√¢ch√©. On the other hand, this prevents them for getting stuck in corners, but they are [i]seriously[/i] hard to balance on.

As the player progresses in the game, most trophies and their mirrored Steam achievements will unlock, and some of them actually provides you with upgraded abilities, such as the possibility to look down (largely useless) and killing certain monsters faster.

[h1]Story[/h1]
As most people will notice, the English translation is severely lacking, which contributes negatively to the overall experience, though in its defense it is clearly understandable and doesn't hamper the story as much as it could have, especially during in-game tutorial messages. On the other hand, this is also because the story is mostly non-existent and just an excuse plot for sending our furry protagonist on a platformy journey. Which doesn't have to be all that bad, since it is a platformer after all, but it has to be said. The comic style cinematics are few (only between worlds) and neither original or visionary. 'Decent' is a generous word here.

[h1]Graphics[/h1]
For a pure 2D platformer, the simplistic and cute art style is generally appealing, with the colourful game world, protagonist and various inhabitants, background assets and items blending nicely together. It is easy to plan your navigation, in theory at least. Unfortunately, the overall state of the game prevents it from serving more usefulness.

[h1]Media[/h1]
Apart from the above mentioned cutscenes, the game provides generic music for each of the three game worlds and the boss fights. It is nothing noteworthy but serves its purpose for setting the atmosphere and keeping it lively. Sound effects are standard on-hit noises and bouncy jumps.

[h1]Achievements[/h1]
The poor translation makes it really hard to figure out some of the achievements but they seem to all naturally unlock during a normal playthrough, as long as you kill most of the enemies on the way. For achievement hunters, it should be a walk in the park [i]if[/i] you are strong enough to endure the game till its completion.

[h1]Overall[/h1]
I originally gave this game a chance because of its charming looks and casual attitude and would still recommend it to players that are looking for a relaxing platformer for recreational purposes or whatever. However, due to its incredibly sloppy controls, I am starting to fear that even this target group will instead experience unreasonable frustration, and they might as well rather feel that frustration playing a harder game with better responsiveness. If you happen to own the game already, I encourage you to give it a try and see for yourself, but otherwise I cannot advise you to obtain it. It is dangerously mediocre and there are many better alternatives out there.


[table]
    [tr]
        [th]Pros[/th]
        [th]Cons[/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Cute graphics[/td]
        [td]Frustrating controls[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Relaxing difficulty[/td]
        [td]Health design flaws[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Smooth level design[/td]
        [td]Generic content[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td][/td]
        [td]Poor translation[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td][/td]
        [td]Uninteresting story[/td]
    [/tr]
[/table] 

Gameplay: 4/10
Story: 5/10
Graphics: 7/10
Media: 5/10

[u]Overall: 4/10[/u]

author: {'steamid': '76561198063574735', 'num_games_owned': 21371, 'num_reviews': 263, 'playtime_forever': 1244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1244, 'last_played': 1438409451}
review:
Big Fish Legend is a cute casual side-scrolling platformer game that incorporates a few easy puzzle elements.

In each of the 60 levels that the game offers, you guide the kitty to the exit, jumping from platform to platform or vertically climbing walls (it's a cat after all, cats can always do funny stunts), collecting gems on the way that replenish the kitty's life. There are various monsters to defeat by jumping on them using different mechanics. Indicators that show which way to go are present in almost every screen, so it's quite easy to find the exit; however, the way is sometimes blocked by doors that need to be open either by collecting a key or by pushing an object on the button that controls the door, triggering it to open. And this is where the puzzle element comes into the picture - you need to bring those objects to the right location and sometimes this requires a bit of planning ahead, making use of the surroundings and a few timed jumps.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=491914139
The collision is quite good in the game and the levels are designed so that the objects don't get stuck in weird places; and even if a ball appears to not be movable because it ended up in a tight place, it's enough for the cat to push against it a bit for the ball to start moving due to its inertia.

The difficulty of the levels is rather constant, there's no increase apart from a few special ones that are timed or in which you have to avoid damaging the monsters; however not even those are very challenging and are easily done after 2 or 3 tries. This makes the game accessible not only to casual gamers, but to children too, despite the fact that it's not a kids game.

The aspect in which Big Fish Legend is lacking though is the story. I would have loved a more detailed one instead of the 3 comic book pages that the game offers.

Despite the fact that the game's legitimacy on Steam is heavily debated on the forums and despite the fact that the developers did some unprofessional things for promoting it, I think this is a very enjoyable game. I consider the asking price to be way too high for what the game itself offers, but I appreciate the fact that they provided thousands of copies through giveaways in order to fix their mistakes.

[quote]More reviews on the [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/11354094]Lilly's Corner Curator page[/url][/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198114750286', 'num_games_owned': 221, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 396, 'last_played': 1439796578}
review:
First of all, Im not a critic...
Big Fish Legend is a good Casual Platformer, I find it even more entertaining than Mario himself, because I love cats...
There are a lot of negative reviews just because the develepor ''Scammed and lied'' to the people.
Thats not exactly true...There was a big giveaway on this game https://steamcompanion.com/gifts/wp4k/big-fish-legend/ And I was one of the winners.
I don't see how the devs lied, because there are several big giveaways ''Free copies'' of the game on Steam Companion.
Its not a bad game, considering I got it for free and had so much fun with it :D
Yes, I know, its a kids game, but still is a good and fun platformer, you have to admit.
I here you saying ( negative reviewers ), that its a boring platformer with repeating levels, which are the same...
Isn't every platformer with the same level ? What is the difference between this platformer and other platformers ???
If anyone disagrees, comment on this review and send me a game that is  a platformer, which has different levels.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011501280', 'num_games_owned': 2610, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1441208055}
review:
As Shoppa already mentioned in his review, the devs of this game  have been using very underhanded tactics to promote their game, which in itself makes it questionable that this game has any place or business to be on Steam. Then again, since asset flipping games are apparently okay, why am I even surprised? 
Funny facts: many positive reviews you see for the game were made by devs friend or probably they are alts by the devs itself, so dont let those fool you

What comes about the game: very generic platformy thingy with a mismash of maps, controls feel unnecessary floaty and make precise jumps literally impossible, music is repetitive at best and quite headache inducing after 10 seconds.  
Even with only 5 minutes into this game, I can tell you that this is not a very good one and I seriously doubt it will get any better. The 10 dollar pricetag is a hilarious joke, I could find 100 times better games on Kongregate or on Armorgames (for free, I may add)

Overall rating would be a 2 out of 10 and I was yet being very kind. Shady dev, many contrevery about whether or not the game was using stolen stuff, dont even bother.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001518866', 'num_games_owned': 11856, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1437693735}
review:
[i]This game is an casual platformer dedicated to everyone but mostly to under 14 , you control a kitty which have to collect shinies across various levels accompanied by some nice music, there is not much depth to it but is fairly made and simply, you will not be punished if you die, you just start from the last checkpoint, you can play with only Mouse or directional keys on the Keyboard.
Considering the price I think is slighty 'fat' for what he can offer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969158018', 'num_games_owned': 11171, 'num_reviews': 227, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1506415005}
review:
I have just played this game for 5 minutes - and I just wanted to say that this a great game for kids or people with limited use of their hands.

It's a casual platformer {not hardcore at all}, the main character (a cat) can be controlled by the use of the mouse only, very simple, and the aim is to find the exit and collect some gems along the way.

It's easy to look at, understand and play, and is quite cute!

author: {'steamid': '76561198053070206', 'num_games_owned': 9982, 'num_reviews': 267, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1559009262}
review:
Hmm, this game is targeted for little kids.
Considering the price it's expensive $6.29 for a simple platforming game with no purpose
Your mission each level is just jumping here and there and get to the exit. rinse and repeat.

Many people got this game for free because of the greenlight campaign (Vote and get a free Steam Key)
There is also a serious case with the developer, you can read it here http://steamcommunity.com/id/shoppa2/recommended/376560/

And yeah, I didn't recommend this game. I don't find any good value in the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169237639', 'num_games_owned': 930, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1561696214}
review:
Un juego amigable y adorable, con buena musica
los controles son basicos y faciles de usar, todo es con las direccionales, en el juego deberemos recolectar todos los diamantes exparsidos por el nivel, algo parecido a Spyro pero en un ambiente de plataforma, al final de cada nivel nos tomaran como Ranking el total de gemas, lugares ocultos y total de enemigos, para Oro, plata o bronze.

Personalmente recomiendo el juego a los que solian pasarse un buen rato jugando en su celular (Antes de los tactiles), me recuerdo mucho a uno llamado Gulo Tale`s o bien bien si te gustan los plataformas relajados donde no se te debe olvidar o dejar nada en el nivel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034125788', 'num_games_owned': 8096, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1437567376}
review:
[h1]This game got past greenlight, how?[/h1]

First they occurred like they were the owner of WhoIsGamingNow (A big website which helps Greenlight developers getting exposure)
When the owner of WGN told them to stop they wouldn't listen and threatened him to help them advertise.
http://i.imgur.com/0BiO0Zx.png

That didn't seem to work out good enough for them to get greenlit, so they hosted a "vote for a free key" campaign, which got them at least 1k votes.
http://i.imgur.com/6SNzzoG.png

Both developers also haven't given a single sign on their forum, while 1 of the developers is playing games all day.

This game has atm 38 positive reviews, most if not all are from friends of the developer.
2 of the 3 showing reviews have the developer added in their friends list, which is shown here:
https://youtu.be/6h0Oy61Gt48

[h1]What about the game?[/h1]
It's a simple jump platformer game, where you have to collect gems.
This is one of those games you used to play for free on the internet when you were bored.

I'd say that it might be worth $1 to make a kid happy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025116695', 'num_games_owned': 7739, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1455914123}
review: Ein sehr sh√∂nes Spiel mit gutem Gameplay und vollst√§ndigen Lokalisierung auf Deutsch untermahlt mit einer guten und nicht  aufdringlichen Musik. Die Levels sind abwechslungsreich und fordernd.
